content.description: A cube with side length <math alttext="0.02 meter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.02</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>m</mtext> </math> is made of a material with density <math alttext="2700 kilograms per meter cubed" overflow="scroll"><mn>2700</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math> and specific heat <math alttext="900 joules per kilogram kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>900</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J/</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>â‹…</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. The cube is initially at a temperature of <math alttext="260 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>260</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> when it is placed in a thermally insulated container filled with water at temperature of <math alttext="280 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>280</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math>. The water transfers <math alttext="200 joules" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></math> of energy by heating to the cube.
content.question: What is the final temperature of the cube?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
